Just from a former military perspective, while these 'regular Texans' weren't in "combat" many, many of them were literally fighting for their lives recently. No power for days on end during sub-freezing temperatures, no heat, no electricity, not even much hope if they would survive through it and now that power is coming back for some, now no water in many places. And these Texans watch 1 of their "leaders" run off to Cancun just to escape the weather when they are left in the freezing cold, alone, possibly to die? No matter the reasons or excuses they are given for his trip, true or not, the bottom line is: To those Texans who were suffering and literally fighting for their lives recently? To them OPTICS MATTER. Appearances matter. If you are supposed to be a "leader" and you leave your soldiers behind (or in this case your constituents) it's just not right. At all. Just my own thoughts.

It's a fair perspective. Consider this though. Let's say this happened in Washington. No power anywhere, no electricity, water frozen, etc. Would you want Biden to stay in a federal disaster area freezing his ass off with his family? I would hope he gets his old ass outta there. Yes he is our leader. Thankfully, politicians can do there job with just a computer or cell phone. It's not the same as a firefighter needing to be in the fire.

Meanwhile, while Biden or in this case Cruz protects themselves and there family like any decent human being, they do there jobs as politicians which is to enforce policies. Pressure the workers and companies to communicate and fix the problem, encourage citizens to help each other and offer information on shelters and other resources, enforce policies to prevent this kind of disaster from happening again, ask the president to declare federal disaster so more outside aid arrives which people desperately need, etc. All these things Cruz has reportedly done, and Biden would've done the same, while also protecting himself and his family.


Does it look bad if you are freezing your ass off and hear about a rich politician going to Cancun? Oh absolutely! That's the last thing I assume you wanna hear about. But it also makes sense; I'm sure that same family would book a flight and get the hell outta there if they could. But this isn't someone running away and not doing there job. It's not a police officer running away from a robbery, or a fire fighter abandoning a burning building. Ted Cruz can't unfreeze pipelines, but he can pressure people as a politician to get the job done, which he is doing. Meanwhile, he is freezing with his family just like everybody else. If they can protect themselves and get out of there while also continuing to help, he should.

Just my perspective. I see what you are saying, just offering a different perspective

Grow up snowflakes.... I live is south Texas and spent 10 years stationed In Fort Campbell,  KY plus more further northeast  Winter weather there was expected and tolerable to a certain point.. We never see weather like this except every 15 to 20 years. Believe me it wasn't as bad as the media exaggerates it is. I could have slept outside with just a sleeping bag. We loved it. I am a Texas resident. We had rolling blackouts every two hours but we were prepared for the most part.

Our power plants ran at 100 percent but our mini grid had to share with the rest of the state.

Our largest outage was 6 hours. The lowest temp we saw in our home was 65 degrees despite 18 outside degrees F.

Our home is not 100 percent electric on purpose. We still had hot water and could have used our gas oven for heat. We did not. We have a small generator but never felt the need to crank it.

In our city, if you were lucky enough to share the grid with a hospital, you did not have electricity outages.

So every two hours our home got a boost of heat and the insulation kept us warm.

My wife and I are in our mid sixties.

When we saw the wave about to hit, I did drain and replenish the cooling/antifreeze fluid on a vehicle. That was a challenge rolling under a car at 18 degrees but got it done.

The left is blaming deregulation and the Right is blaming too much dependence on wind and solar. Did the deregulation cause budget cuts to compete? Did the budget cuts cause the de icing equipment not to be included on the wind powered generation? Who knows. I understand some of the circuitry was under insulated with some of the necessary switching blah blah blah. This has been the case for years snd years according to one of my inside sources who is familiar with the Texas grid.

Did the deregulation in Texas allow for advantages for certain groups to secure market shares? Maybe so maybe no. I can’t tell you but there’s lip flapping in that direction.

Whatever the case, failures have pointed out weaknesses in the grid and its supply. We will figure it out and get r done.

Maybe we can get some of that Paris Agreement money.

I’m in north central TX. I was without power and water from Sunday night to Wednesday late afternoon. We were painfully freezing, unable to cook or heat up something to drink, and sitting in the dark. Roads were icy and even fast food and grocery store were closed due to no power/water so venturing out to find a warm meal wasn’t an option. They reported today that so far they have found six people who have died. Four of which were in their homes. Who knows what the news will report tomorrow. We had lakes actually freeze over which hasnt happened before. We were supposed to have rolling blackouts per ERCOT. They took down the first group then left us down. They said the grid couldn’t handle the stress of bringing us back online. This I don’t understand. If you are about to take down the next group you would simply be replacing the first. We were told they didn’t know when we would get power back. Gov Abbott called for an investigation and the resignations of those in charge. The top three in ERCOT don’t even live in TX. They live in the northeast and one in Canada. I’ve seen people on social media saying he’s running to Cancun rather than staying during this emergency. I ask what is it that he is supposed to do? I get the leaders lead not run away answer. I ask what more could Ted Cruz do that the Governor has already done. Their responses are go door-to-door and hand out bottles of water. My family and I stayed in our painfully cold house. We didn’t expect someone to come to our door. We expected ERCOT to do the right thing and actually do the rolling blackouts that they had said they were going to do.
If I was in Cruz’s position financially I may not have gone to Cancun but you can be damn sure I would’ve taken my family and pets to a hotel outside of Texas where it was warmer and had power and running water.
It feels like the real Texans aren’t complaining and are actually doing something about their problems.

From a personal experience, Texas is beginning to fail all of us time and time again. Sure we got the virus somewhat under control, but thanks to politicians redirecting our attention away from the pandemic and focusing on small and unnecessary things like racial profiling and immigration, we were able to let something like this happen to us. Innocent people died of hypothermia, and or killed themselves because CO2 was their only source of heat. My power was out for 2 days and me, my grandmother, and uncle damn near froze to death. Our meat supply in the state has been affected to the point to where it will take about 6 weeks to fully be recovered. We are lucky enough to hear that our water supply will be back to normal by Sunday or Monday. I am by God a Texan,  who lives in a very rural area.  My family will not be caught off-guard again. We have a generator, and that saved us. We have plenty food,  but our well pipes froze, because our generator is small and after we ran out of gas we had a hard time getting to a store to get more...but we finally did... Alas,  it was too late, our well pipes froze. We have been without water and grid power for a week. BUT,  we knew it was coming so we stored plenty water for a week. We are cooking stews and tacos,  and soups and can goods in our fireplace. We have candles, small solar lights, and flash lights for light. We have three children under 13 and we made it... I've  seen many friends and neighbors helping each other with free firewood, shelter, food, and hay for livestock and pets. Don't underestimate Texans, especially rural Texans! We should all be more self sufficient. Stop relying on others to help you in a time of need. If you can, prepare and be ready to help others in your community. LDRSHIP is an acronym for the seven basic values of the United States Army:

Loyalty - Bear true faith and allegiance to the U.S. Constitution, the Army, your unit and other soldiers.
Duty - Fulfill your obligations.
Respect - Treat people as they should be treated.
Selfless Service - Put the welfare of the nation, the Army, and your subordinates before your own.
Honor - Live up to all the Army values.
Integrity - Do what’s right, legally and morally.
Personal Courage - Face fear, danger, or adversity [physical or mentally].
